comment.author: 11131822@N00
comment._content: as soon as I saw this pic I knew it to be the silver city comet which I rode probably pre 1980, after moving interstate for a bit I was saddened to see it had been withdrawn from service, I remember the trip as being different from any other train trip I had taken since the late 1950's

comment.author: 21945254@N03
comment._content: It's a gorgeous train. It's funny because nowadays you can drive from Sydney to Moss Vale a lot quicker then that.

comment.author: 50622330@N07
comment._content: Wow - 70 years later and it still takes the same amount of time to travel by train between Sydney and Moss vale.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content:
Power van DP 101 was the first of five built in the NSW Railway workshop at Eveleigh (Redfern) in 1937.
Ritchie Bros of Auburn, Sydney, NSW, built twelve air-conditioned passengers cars of which three are preserved at the Sulphide Street Railway Museum Broken Hill.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection
